answers.answer: Sorry to hear that health care providers kick you out without addressing your issues and have accused you.  I couldn't tell you if it is insulinoma or not, you would have to get that tested.  Insulinoma is a rare tumour on the pancreas which stimulates the pancrease to continuous secreting insulin for you, therefore you do get low.  you might want to get some tests done such as a CT or MRT to confirm it.Something on the side, do you eat enough carbohydrates during the day?, if you don't eat enough carbohydrates or didn't eat for a long time, you will experience symptoms of low blood sugar.  i would not recommend you to leave it to your normal body response, when you are low, most of the times your body can't save you.  it is recommended to have simple sugar (15 grams) such as 3/4 of juice, regular pop, 1 tablespoon of honey, 3 packets of sugar dissolved in water, 6 lifesavers, 3-5 glucose tablets.  After 15 minutes of consuming 15 grams of simple carb, then you would test your blood sugar, if it is 4 and above, then you would eat a small snack such as half sandwich with cheese, or peanut butter (if it is far away from your meal times) to help keep your sugar level up.
